note.p: Death: Red Lion Square, London (02 April 1742)
Burial: Church of St Andrew, Holborn, London
Research Field: Medicine, natural history, letters; anatomy

Career: Settled in London (c1700); practised dissection and midwifery; Physician to the Queen; William Hunter (FRS 1767) became his pupil (1741); Douglas's manuscripts are now in the Hunterian Library of Glasgow University
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Thomas
P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166
Notes: Proposed by Sir Hans Sloane
